intro: Norysca urala var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved norysca, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems that can grow up to 60 centimeters in height. The leaves are elongated and narrow, with a serrated margin, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, blooming in late summer. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
